title: Stoke pick up first Championship win of season with victory at high-flying Swansea
text:
Swansea City 1 Stoke City 2

Nathan Jones believes he can spearhead Stoke’s rise from the Championship mire after a week of ‘soul searching’ ended with a last minute lifeline from Scott Hogan.

The Potters manager was closer than ever to the brink after Andre Ayew gave his struggling side a mountain to climb with a first minute opener.

But Stoke showed clear signs of revival as they rebuilt with an equaliser from former Swansea midfielder Sam Clucas. It looked as though the Potters were going to miss their opportunity to put an end to their miserable 10-game streak until Hogan used his poacher’s instincts to fire home a winner that could turn their season around.

“I know I can turn the job around,” said Jones. “That’s never been the thing.

"I’ve done a lot of thinking and soul searching over the last week and I’m a passionate guy, that’s got me the career I’ve had. At Luton I was a passionate guy who drove the team on and the fans loved me for it. Here, it’s the Championship, it’s much scrutinised, so I’ve gone back to being me, and I like being me because I have to live with me.
description: Nathan Jones believes he can spearhead Stoke’s rise from the Championship mire after a week of ‘soul searching’ ended with a last minute lifeline from Scott Hogan.
